Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your digital journey starts here!




Create. Grow. Deliver our story to millions.

#BTCode, where technology meets creativity. Code is our universal language and innovation is the fuel that propels us into the future. 🚀




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team.

This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to understand and document their requirements, analyze data, and support the development of data warehouse (DW) structures and reporting solutions.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Document detailed requirements for data warehouse developments, ensuring clarity and completeness.
Work closely with DW developers to design and validate new data structures required for reporting and analytics.
Test data structures during system migrations to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and alignment with business requirements.
Develop and execute test cases and validate results to confirm the success of data migration or transformation processes.
Maintain comprehensive documentation in tools like Confluence, detailing data requirements, solutions, and testing processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, data engineers, and external vendors, to deliver high-quality solutions.
Actively use Jira and Clarity to track tasks, document progress, and ensure timely delivery of projects.
Ensure adherence to data governance policies and maintain high standards for data accuracy and security.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights as needed to support decision-making processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, with a focus on data (1 year).
Experience with data warehouse development and reporting.
Good with SQL for data extraction and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Qlik Sense).
Knowledge of Jira, Confluence, and Clarity.
Understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.




If you want to find out what other jobs we still have available, like Life at BT or what #Culture BT is, you can also access the Bank's career website: https://cariere.bancatransilvania.ro/ .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.




Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.




We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.







Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.




Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.




We are looking for a

Data Analyst




Full Time | Amersfoort




As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.




You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.




Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.




In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.




What will you be doing:

Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business







What will you bring?

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
Fluent in English




Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.




Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.




BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Show more
HTML:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.


Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.


We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.



Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.


Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.


We are looking for a

Data Analyst


Full Time | Amersfoort


As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.


You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.


Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.


In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.


What will you be doing:

  • Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
  • Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
  • Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
  • Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
  • Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business



What will you bring?

  • At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
  • Experience in building and maintaining data models
  • Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
  • Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
  • Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
  • Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
  • Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
  • Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
  • Fluent in English


Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.


Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.


BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Title: Assistant Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Rattaché(e) au département CRM, vous assisterez la responsable Data et l’accompagnerez dans l’ensemble de sa réflexion sur le pilotage et la compréhension du client Diptyque et plus particulièrement son comportement envers la marque et ses achats actuels ou futurs.




Description de poste :




Réalisation de reportings et de dashboards pour assurer le suivi régulier des KPIs clients et mise en lumière des enseignements associés
Réalisation d’analyses détaillées sur les opérations marketing ou dispositifs d’animations visant à mettre en évidence les succès ou les points d’amélioration.
Participation à la réalisation d’analyses approfondies sur le comportement client (omnicanalité, parcours de recrutement, performance produits…)
Monitoring des actions CRM afin de challenger le plan de contact et les ciblages associés
Participer à l’acculturation des différents interlocuteurs concernés tout en faisant preuve de pédagogie




Les missions ne sont pas exhaustives et peuvent évoluer en fonction des projets.




Profil recherché :




De formation supérieure type école d’ingénieur ou Master 2 avec une spécialisation en statistiques ou data, vous recherchez un stage de Data Analyst pour une durée de 6 mois à partir de juillet 2025.




Vous maitrisez impérativement SQL, et savez utiliser au moins un langage d’analyse de données tels que R ou Python. Une connaissance de Tableau serait un plus.

Vous avez un attrait pour le monde du Retail.




Vous vous reconnaissez dans le profil suivant :

· Bonne communication (en anglais et en français)

· Rigueur et organisation

· Esprit analytique et de synthèse

· Capacité à concevoir des présentations de vos analyses

· Vous connaissez les méthodes de machine learning

Show more

Title: BI Data Analyst - Remote First in Ireland
Description:
BI Data Analyst – Remote First

Permanent ¦¦ Remote First ¦¦ Ireland

€40,000 – €50,000 DOE




TechHeads has partnered with an Irish SaaS company looking for their first BI Data Analyst to join their team.




You will have an opportunity to develop new processes and functions for BI and data across the organisation with an opportunity for career progression as the first member of this team.




This role allows for the opportunity to work with modern BI reporting tools such as QuickSight and develop your SQL skillset by writing queries and creating individual client BI reports.




Engagement with customers as well as internal groups such as Engineering and Customer Success Teams will allow for collaborative efforts to understand requirements and deliver tailored insights.




This role provides the opportunity to be involved in first of its kind AI Data solutions working on an enterprise scale. Working with the latest in tech innovation such as AI chatbots and AI Voice solutions for organisations in Finance, Banking and Insurance.




The company’s remote first approach offers flexibility and improved work-life balance for the successful candidate. You will also form part of a collaborative and friendly team. Training will also be provided where necessary to further help you develop and grow your career.




Requirements:

2+ Years Experience in SQL – Writing Queries
BI/Data Visualisation Tool such as QuickSight, Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Preferred Industry Experience; Call Centres, SaaS Product Company, Financial Services/Insurance/Banking.)
Nice to Have; Python or ETL Experience but not essential.
Candidate must currently be located in Ireland and hold an EU Passport or Stamp 4 Visa.




Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: €40,000 - €50,000 DOE
Comprehensive benefits package including, healthcare, pension, remote first, home equipment allowance and gym membership.




If you would like to be considered for this position, please share a copy of your updated CV to thomas@techheads.ie

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst occupies an essential role within our data-driven organization, collaborating with product, tech, and marketing teams while reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead. The primary purpose of this role is to support stakeholders in making informed decisions by proactively identifying challenges and opportunities through data analysis, leading to tangible and positive impacts on the business.




What you will do:

Proactively contribute ideas to improve business performance.
Utilize statistical methods and data visualization to identify trends and provide data interpretations.
Gather, analyze, and translate business requirements into actionable data insights.
Suggest and evaluate product experiments.
Proactively contribute to improve team workflow, processes, tools, etc.
Aid stakeholders in crafting well-informed decisions.
Suggest, define and monitor impactful KPIs.
Identify relevant data and ensure availability.
Give data driven recommendations.
Maintain data availability and improve data utilization.
Design, develop, and maintain data models and databases.
Extract, transform, and load data for analysis.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and ensure data quality.
If asked, mentor junior team members




Who you are:

4+ years of relevant work experience.
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Tableau
Knowledge in R, Jupyter, or similar tools is beneficial
Strong understanding of databases, data modelling and data integration.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation abilities.
Familiarity with git, docker, or dbt is desirable.
Background or familiarity in Data Science projects (ML, pattern recognition, forecasting, fraud detection, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in the AdTech industry or in mobile app analytics is a plus.




Why you will love working here:

Invest in Your Future: Regular feedback and our development program support your growth, helping you expand your skill set and achieve your career goals.
Easy Arrival to justDice: From signing to settling in Hamburg, we’ve got you covered. Need a visa? No problem. Ready to build your new life and career at justDice in Hamburg? We support every ambition—from learning German to a relocation bonus that helps you settle in and make Hamburg feel like home.
Live Your Best Life, at Work and Beyond: We work in a hybrid setup with 3 core office days, plus flexible working hours. Enjoy 30 vacation days, 3 weeks of remote work per year, and free access to an in-house gym with lots of different fitness classes and mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
Thrive Where You Work: Enjoy the Alster lake view from our central office with top notch equipment, fun open spaces, and a large variety of snacks and drinks.
Join the Community! Participate in regular team and company events, including hackathons and social gatherings. We work together, and we celebrate together, too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.




Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.




We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
Uses their initiative to problem solve
Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
Exceptional analytical and time management skills
Exceptional communication skills




At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

Competitive salary
Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
Several discounts available with our partners
Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
Remote Working Available
An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
…and much more!

Show more

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.




Job Description




Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success




Job Purpose




As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.




Main Duties:




Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor’s Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures







Qualifications




Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment




What We Offer:




A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.




Additional Information




If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.




Location and Availability Requirements:




Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS




What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Show more

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
  • Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
  • Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
  • Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
  • Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
  • Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
  • Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment


What We Offer:


  • A dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
  • Collaboration with a talented, international team.


Additional Information


If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.


Location and Availability Requirements:


  • Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
  • 39 working hours/ week
  • Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS


What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
Junior Analyst

Processing data is our core business. We use data to develop, train, and implement models while creating a deeper understanding of business processes for our clients. We believe that data should never be processed in isolation or without the proper context. That’s why we provide contextual analytics—taking into account what the data represents, rather than just analyzing numbers or text stored in a file or database.

And yes, we also develop and train AI/ML models, but only if they add value to what our clients expect from us.

Role

As a Junior Analyst, you will work closely with senior analysts and managers to collect, process, and define data for various projects. This involves conducting detailed data analyses to determine data quality, performing fit-for-purpose assessments, and designing and implementing data pipelines.

To ensure high-quality and meaningful results, you will continuously validate outputs and underlying assumptions. This is achieved by reviewing relevant documentation and discussing findings with internal or client subject matter experts.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract, process, and classify data from structured sources
Develop models to extract data from unstructured sources
Build models to forecast (financial) metrics
Create key metrics to identify patterns and insights
Develop dashboards for (senior) management
Define implementation strategies for productionizing analyses

What We Offer

We value individual contributions and encourage professional growth. We enjoy working together and learning from each other. Our clients benefit from our expertise, and our colleagues develop as professionals.

Our assignments are challenging and diverse, meaning no two days, projects, or clients are the same.

Benefits:

Competitive salary with a bonus scheme
Hybrid & flexible working options, plus 30 vacation days
A young, dynamic, and diverse team with passion and ambition
Two additional leave days per year for volunteering
Choice of a company car or public transport card
Laptop, phone, and internet allowance (also for personal use)

Your Profile

We are looking for ambitious individuals with a strong understanding of mathematics and its applications. You should have an intrinsic drive to learn and understand business processes, as well as the ability to analyze and interpret data in a meaningful way.

Education:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, or Quantitative Finance

Required Skills:

Basic programming knowledge (Python, R, SQL)
Ability to design and implement mathematical models
Strong foundation in statistical analysis

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Barden are delighted to be partnering with a multinational based in Cork to assist them in hiring an experienced Data Analyst. This in an urgent requirement and will initially be a 12 month contract.




It is a hybrid role and you would be required to be on site 2 - 3 days per week.




We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst with around 3-4 years commercial experience. The ideal person would have a lot of experience utilizing advanced excel functions to manipulate and analyse large datasets.




You will have strong data mining, and data interpretation experience as the role involves analysing data, identifying trends, and developing actionable insights.




You will be comfortable using SQL and Tableau to create different reports from a broad range of data.




Perform data mining to extract relevant insights from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and reliability.




Prepare and present analytical reports to management, highlighting key trends and recommendations.




You will have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders.




If you would like to hear more about this new opportunity please reach out to me today at dan.hoctor@barden.ie

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!




Impactful projects
Accelerate your career
Gain experience across multiple domains




Join a well-established Irish company that values its employees and invests in long-term career development. This is a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to refine their skills in a supportive environment while working across multiple domains!




As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making, leveraging AI-powered insights, and mastering industry-leading tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




You'll receive hands-on mentorship from seasoned professionals with over 20 years of experience, ensuring your growth in both technical expertise and business acumen.




You will:

Work with large datasets, using AI to improve efficiency and decision-making
Develop expertise in Power BI, Tableau, and SQL to create impactful visualizations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies
Translate complex data into actionable insights for key stakeholders
Thrive in a dynamic environment with long-term career growth opportunities.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!

Title: Data analyst | Mid
HTML:
The Data, Research, and Insights department possesses a growth mindset based on insightful data. We enjoy performing statistical analyses with Looker, BigQuery, Google Analytics, and Tableau to conclude product or customer experience improvement.

About the role: we are looking for a Data analyst to turn the data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will analyze trends, create reports, and collaborate cross-functionally to support data-driven strategies. The ideal candidate is both data-driven and results-driven, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Main Responsibilities

  • Help define KPIs and monitor them in automated reports and dashboards;
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities;
  • Present findings in a clear, compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation and governance;
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with other departments to help them track the results, find valuable insights, and deliver data-driven decisions




Core Requirements

  • You have demonstrated experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing complex data using SQL;
  • You are interested in data storytelling and have hands-on experience with BI tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI) and statistical analysis methods;
  • You have strong communication and collaboration skills;
  • You are attentive to detail;
  • Experience with SaaS products will be a big advantage




Tools you will use

  • Google Bigquery, Looker, Google Analytics 4, GS / Excel




Salary range

  • Gross Salary 2200-4500 EUR/month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.
NordLayer is an adaptive network access security solution for modern businesses developed by the standard of NordVPN.

We help organizations of all sizes enhance their internet security and modernize network and resource access with technical improvements aligning with the best regulatory compliance standards. Helping organizations to adopt ZTNA principles, NordLayer is focused on the Security Service Edge of cybersecurity services.

Quick and easy to integrate with existing infrastructure, hardware-free, and designed with ease of scale in mind, NordLayer meets the varying growth pace and ad-hoc cybersecurity requirements of agile businesses and distributed workforces today.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, online and on-site workouts, consultations to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • More free time. Stay with us and additional vacation days will be added to your calendar;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

The role of the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst plays an essential part within the global BI team that supports Global Finance Services. Reporting to the BI Manager, the BI Analyst will focus on the development, delivery and maintenance of analytics solutions to support informed decision-making, better control over operations and provide transparency performance metrics.

What you'll do?


Desig reports that answer business questions/requirements and make the most of our visualization tools capabilities
Lead by example by designing powerful user-focused content following our design standards
Lead the development cycle of assigned projects
Provision of clear status updates about expected deadlines
Continue to develop your knowledge of management information tools and techniques, and share this knowledge with your team and across our users
Participate in discussions with senior leaders regarding relevant technical matters
Provide technical expertise on the relevant tools where required to the support team in troubleshooting, in discussions with the vendor, senior management and internal IT teams


Qualifications

What you'll bring?


2+ years practical experience developing reports with Tableau Desktop and Prep
Technical IT degree preferred or other relevant qualification
Knowledge of data visualization best practice and trends, UX mindset
And ability to present to senior stakeholders
Experience within challenging, dynamic, matrix-based management structures
Knowledge of trends and latest possibilities in MI/BI, data and automation
Mindset of innovation and process improvement, ability to lead changes
Fluent English


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Boost your Career!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Boost your Career!

Gain hands-on experience from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a data-driven professional eager to accelerate your career? This is your chance to join a well-established Irish-owned company that prioritizes professional growth and long-term career development.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst with 1–3 years of experience in data analysis who is ready to take the next step in their career. You’ll work across multiple business functions, turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive strategic decision-making.




Under the mentorship of a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows, refining your skills in SQL and data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau. This is the perfect opportunity to develop into a Senior Data Analyst while making an impact from day one!




You will:

Analyse large, complex datasets to generate valuable business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions.
Receive direct mentorship and guidance from a Senior Data Analyst.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
  • Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.

Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €35,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!


For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.


For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description


In-Platform Quality Assurance: Conduct regular audits to maintain data integrity and platform performance.
Audience Testing: Proactively test and resolve issues before they impact operations.
Incident Handling: Troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
CDP Configurations & Governance: Manage configurations, approval flows, and access governance to align with business needs & compliance.
First-Line Support: Provide hands-on assistance toregional and central teams.
Documentation & Knowledge Sharing: Maintain clear documentation of configurations, workflows, and troubleshooting guides to support scalability and knowledge transfer.
Collaboration with Engineering & Data Teams: Work closely with data engineers and analysts to optimize data pipelines, resolve technical issues, and enhance CDP functionality.
Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and refine processes to improve efficiency in audience activation, segmentation, and data governance.


Qualifications


Hands-on experience withSaaS applications: CDP's, marketing automation tools and data integrations.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, particularly withinGCP BigQuery.
Experience withCDPSolutions( i.e. Hightouch, Mparticle, Segment, ActionIQ)is highly desirable.
Understanding how the CDP supports business users in achieving their goals and integrates with key business processes.
Deep understanding of GDPR and the importance of RBAC with the ability to manage configurations, user access, and platform governance processes.
Effective communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.


Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a ‘Best Place to Work’ globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!

We’re excited to share that Yext has recently joined forces with Hearsay Systems, forming a unified organization that is stronger than ever. This strategic acquisition enhances our ability to deliver world-class solutions by combining industry-leading digital presence management with compliant engagement solutions across social media, text, and voice. As we begin this exciting new chapter together, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to help us integrate and continue to innovate in our shared mission.

This role will be part of the Hearsay team, now an integral part of Yext.

This is a hybrid position, offering the flexibility of remote telework with the requirement to be on-site at least one day per week on average. Occasional adjustments may be made based on team needs or project demands.

This is a maternity cover position, estimated to last up to 18 months.

As a Data Analyst on the Value Consulting team, you’re passionate about translating a large volume of numbers into actionable business recommendations. Your work will help Yext customers and colleagues make more informed decisions; customers will better understand how to optimize their social media and compliant texting programs, and our company will continue learning how to better serve them in these efforts.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay


What You Have


3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects


Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do

  • Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
  • Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
  • Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
  • Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
  • Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
  • Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
  • Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay

What You Have

  • 3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
  • Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
  • SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
  • Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects

Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Company: Bitcoinsensus

Location: Fully Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time Contractor




About Us:




Bitcoinsensus is a leading entity in the cryptocurrency space, committed to sharing knowledge through multiple social media platforms and our website. We’re focused on real-time market analysis, comprehensive guides, and insightful reviews, serving a diverse audience ranging from blockchain and crypto beginners to experts.

Role Overview:




We’re seeking a skilled Data Analyst who can turn raw data into actionable insights. The role requires a deep understanding of how to work with complex datasets, identify trends, and communicate key findings to influence strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities




Collect, clean, and interpret large datasets to uncover actionable insights.
Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Mixpanel, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and measure performance.
Support data-driven decision-making processes by providing clear and concise recommendations.
Provide key reports, trends & insights that will enable the business to implement strategic & commercial decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across projects.

Qualifications & Skills




Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A commercial mindset and understanding on how to translate data & insights into critical business & commercial decisions
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Excellent communication skills to convey insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What We Offer

Salary that is based on your experience and skill set
Fully remote work setting
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.
Show more

What's in for you:

  • International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst HR Junior
Description:
Max Mara Fashion Group
An Italian House of Brands, Family Owned Since 1951.



Passion, commitment and tradition have created a unique fashion style: today 10 Main Brands and more than 60 different Collections find common ground in quality, style and respect for the distinctive feature that make Max Mara Fashion Group one of the most famous worldwide.



Max Mara Fashion Group, with more than 40 companies and over 5,500 employees, operates in 105 countries.
Our ecosystem is made of more than 50 Departments, including Fashion Design, Marketing, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc. in an Holistic approach to our Customers and leveraging all the new digital competences.





Job Description



The HRIS analyst collects, organizes, analyzes, and interprets data contained within the company’s HRIS (HCM Systems, HR Databases and more). He/She studies the data, and creates reports summarizing important findings. He/She works closely with other teams and stakeholders to identify data points that would be significant, and then perform data analysis to gather that information.
The HRIS analyst should be comfortable using programming languages, proficient with data analytics, and should have experience using tools for data visualization like Tableau,Power BI, etc. Familiarity with HR software programs is helpful. Strong organizational skills are required.
Reports to the HR Digital Manager/Coordinator





Qualifications







Manages the Information Design tools connected to Data Visualization (dynamic and interactive representation through BI dashboards)
Develops new knowledge from the analysis of the data it uses to inspire decisions and drive business
Create and manage standard dashboards and other information delivery services for internal customers.
Maintain and develop enterprise-wide metrics for strategic reporting and analysis.
Presents data and analyzes effectively to internal stakeholders
Uses statistical techniques to produce solutions to emerging problems
Develop customized reports to meet user needs.
Capitalizes on the use of insights, findings, datasets and statistical models for various business needs
Keeps updated on new tools and techniques of data analysis
Perform regular HRIS data audits to ensure system accuracy.
Team with IT to manage system feeds to vendors and other related systems.
Promotes the development of training/learning of the Role through self, digital and collaborative learning activities aimed at innovation and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of one's Responsibilities
Promotes, adopts and develops the use of technologies digital within its function in relation to both the management of the process and in relations with internal and external interlocutors involved in the business
Adopts significant behaviors and promotes actions linked to Sustainable Development, understood as the interconnection of practices oriented towards Environmental Care of Business Processes and Organizational Community
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Helprise - one of the fastest growing outsourcing and consultancy firms providing the best talent, know-how and solutions for the execution of business processes. Be part of building an ecosystem that gives unique value to our customers, partners, candidates and employees. We are your career advocates - offering extraordinary opportunities to grow with us, by supporting top global brands in their development of business and technology services internationally.

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a dynamic team specializing in HR and organizational data analysis. Your primary responsibilities will include data processing, conducting advanced statistical analyses, and delivering valuable business insights.

YOU WILL


Preparing and structuring data - Collecting, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a structured format for analysis
Conducting advanced statistical analyses - Performing regression modeling, time series analysis, and other quantitative methods to uncover trends and patterns
Creating reports and dashboards - Developing clear and concise visual presentations of data insights for business stakeholders
Identifying trends and providing insights - Supporting strategic decision-making through data-driven recommendations
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency - Monitoring data quality and troubleshooting inconsistencies to improve reporting reliability
Collaborating with project teams - Working closely with internal teams and clients to understand analytical needs and provide solutions



Requirements


A higher education degree (preferably in economics, business analytics, statistics, work psychology, or quantitative social sciences)
Minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis
Ability to independently conduct regression and time series analyses
Very good knowledge of Excel (including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools)
Proficiency in spoken and written English
Experience working with both structured and unstructured databases
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to communicate data-driven insights in a clear and compelling manner
Capability to work independently while also effectively collaborating with teams and clients
Proficiency in VBA, R, or Python programming - will be an asset.



Benefits


Flexible Work Arrangements - Adaptable schedules to support work-life balance
Contract Flexibility - Choose from various contract models, including employment contracts and B2B agreements
Sports Card Benefit - Access to a wide range of fitness and wellness facilities
Private Medical Care - Comprehensive, world-class healthcare services
Life Insurance - Financial security with a robust insurance plan
Employee Referral Program - Attractive rewards for successful candidate referrals
Show more
