Title: Associate Data Analyst - Python
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and resolving problems using data.

This is a role for someone with a numerical or data analysis background to play an important part in an exciting area of the Experian business!

What you'll do?


You will deliver analytical projects which will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data.
Communicate your findings to different stakeholders.
Support shaping and refinement of projects.
Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as R, Python and SAS/WPS or equivalent.
Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.


Desirable


Experience using Java, Scala, R or Python within Apache Spark.
Worked with distributed file systems (such as HDFS)
Experience using Linux OS
End-to-end data automation
Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.
Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content


Additional Information

What you will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here


Show more

Title: Data Analyst | Teletrabajo
Description:
En OPTIMISSA tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 5 años de experiencia como Analista de Datos, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Perfil con experiencia como analista de datos, con conocimientos sólidos en creación de informes y dashboards interactivos mediante PowerBI.
Experiencia en visualización de datos.
Experiencia en extracción de insights de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Experiencia con Excel.
Experiencia con Access.







¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Modalidad 100% remota.
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.

Title: Master Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Master Data Analyst


What you’ll have to do:


  • You will act as an expert user who can approve, validate, or reject data maintenance requests;
  • You will maintain/check/modify the master data for suppliers/clients;
  • Ensure compliance with processes/procedures for master data;
  • Provide a single point of contact for stakeholders and offer best practices;
  • Manage, improve, and provide visibility into the company's data performance.


What makes you a good fit:


  • Are passionate about Finance and you want to work in a dynamic environment;
  • Knowledge of the English language - intermediate level;
  • Excel knowledge - intermediate level;
  • Knowledge of the SAP platform is an advantage;
  • Knowledge of the master data module is an advantage;
  • Verbal and written communication skills;
  • Time management skills;
  • Analytical ability to solve problems and apply expert knowledge on master data processes and structures to find the most efficient solution;
  • Ability to understand an end-to-end process;
  • Strong attention to detail.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.




Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo/a y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Data Analyst.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Al menos 4 años de experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
Experiencia en herramientas de reporting, como Power BI.
Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Inglés fluido, nivel alto (B2-C1).




Deseable:




Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
Conocimiento de servicios AWS (Athena, S3...)
Experiencia con metodologías Agile.




¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?




Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.




Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?




We believe

en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.




We want

personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.




We invest

en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.




We foster

una cultura de equipo y generosidad.




Salario:

Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 39k-46k euros al año + BONO

Show more
HTML:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.


Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo/a y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Data Analyst.


¿Qué buscamos en ti?


  • Al menos 4 años de experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
  • Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
  • Experiencia en herramientas de reporting, como Power BI.
  • Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
  • Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
  • Inglés fluido, nivel alto (B2-C1).


Deseable:


  • Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
  • Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
  • Conocimiento de servicios AWS (Athena, S3...)
  • Experiencia con metodologías Agile.


¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?


  • Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
  • Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
  • Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
  • Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
  • Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
  • Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
  • Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
  • Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
  • Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
  • Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
  • Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
  • Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
  • Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.


Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?


We believe

en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.


We want

personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.


We invest

en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.


We foster

una cultura de equipo y generosidad.


Salario:

Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 39k-46k euros al año + BONO

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Accolade

Accolade (Nasdaq: ACCD) provides millions of people and their families with an exceptional healthcare experience that is personal, data driven and value based to help every person live their healthiest life. Accolade solutions combine virtual primary care, mental health support and expert medical opinion services with intelligent technology and best-in-class care navigation. Accolade’s Personalized Healthcare approach puts humanity back in healthcare by building relationships that connect people and their families to the right care at the right time to improve outcomes, lower costs and deliver consumer satisfaction. Accolade consistently receives consumer satisfaction ratings over 90%. For more information, visit accolade.com.




Role overview




The Workforce Data Analyst, reporting to the Director, Workforce Strategy, is responsible for building, managing, and auditing reports for forecasting, scheduling, and other workforce management data as needed.




A day in the life…




Write/program/develop and implement visual data reports and build personalized, interactive data visualizations, reports and dashboards from multiple data sources.
Work with the business to process requirements and convert them into meaningful reports as well as be able to train and communicate the reports to the business stakeholders.
Design & develop automated and distributed frameworks to ingest and transform data from disparate sources across the organization.
Design modern cloud focused data analytics environment.
Work closely with Data Scientists to help build data pipelines for Machine Learning models.
Assist with process definition and library of reusable objects (fields, calculations, KPI, etc.).
Solve issues with minimal direction, identifies data related problems and provide scalable solutions.
Participate in the definition of application scope and objectives through research and fact finding.
Maintain productive working relationships with project sponsors and key systems users.
Communicate and present the reports to the business stakeholders.




What we are looking for…




Solid business acumen; analytical and inquisitive.
Experience with Excel (Qlik and Workday a plus) and data manipulation skills.
Demonstrated experience with data analysis.
Team player capable of effective collaboration across highly matrixed organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely.
Self-starter with a “roll up your sleeves” mindset and desire to add value.




Our people are the Heart of Accolade

Together, we are building a great and enduring business that truly makes an impact. At Accolade, we are committed to building a workplace where all can grow and thrive. ​We do this by living our core values:




Member Obsessed

For everything we do, we ask ourselves: Is this going to make our member’s life measurably better?




Be Fearless

We think differently. We do what’s never been done. We are reinventing healthcare every step of the way.




Stronger Together

We honor the differences among one another and know that our unique perspectives drive us forward.




Genuine Care

We care deeply about the human beings we work with and serve. We have each other’s back.




Embrace Reality

We bring the data, tell the truth, and trust each other.




Relentless Execution

We operate with a bias for action. Take initiative, move fast & have fun.




Accolade is committed to being a company that embraces a hybrid work environment where employees can enjoy the best of both worlds - the flexibility to work from home and the opportunity to have a common place to connect, collaborate, and innovate with others in-person. Our hybrid work model requires that employees who live within 40 miles of an Accolade office are required to be in the office for at least two days during the work week. Accolade will provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.




Accolade is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to advancing an inclusive environment for all qualified applicants and employees. We provide employment opportunities, without regard, to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US. We are committed to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience.




Accolade, Inc., PlushCare, Inc., and Accolade 2ndMD LLC will never ask you to pay to get a job. Anyone who does this is a scammer. Further, we will never send you a check and ask you to send on part of the money or buy gift cards with it. These are also scams. If you see or lose money to a job scam, report it to the Federal Trade Commission at ReportFraud.ftc.gov. You can also report it to your state attorney general.

To review our policy around data use, visit our Accolade Privacy Policy Page. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.




Prague

Prague

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

People Analytics and Measurement is a team composed of over seventy data and analytics professionals who serve internal firm customers.

The Business Intelligence group is responsible for all reporting, performance metrics, and descriptive analytics enabling the firm to understand and optimize our people operations, and measure the impact of our strategic initiatives.

The team works in a highly collaborative environment, partnering with other teams to deliver meaningful innovation in people analytics.

Your Impact

As a People Analytics and Measurement Data Analyst, you will work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to extract, clean, and analyze the firm's people data.

You will develop fluency in the firm's people systems and combine this with your analytical knowledge to help translate business questions into rigorous analysis.

You will be responsible for supporting projects that examine the firm’s feedback and evaluation processes, headcount planning, staffing, feedback, surveys and organizational health and performance metrics.

You will communicate the results of the analysis to the team's internal clients, helping them understand the results and suggesting potential actions supported by the results.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's or graduate degree with focus or specialization in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, social science research, operations research, econometrics, or similar field
1+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics demonstrating success as an individual contributor within a broader team
Solid analytical and data management skills
Ability to plan, prioritize and manage multiple projects, and to work effectively under pressure and with shifting priorities
Flexibility in working style, eager to collaborate with a team (often virtually) and to engage in independent work, based on project and other circumstances
Ability to understand and communicate the meaning of analyses with individuals in a wide range of strategic and operational roles, in both written and oral form
Technical and analytic experience including experience with analytical tools and software such as R (preferred), Python, Tableau, Alteryx, or other programming experience
Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving data from relational databases
Exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify patterns
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, including manipulating large datasets
Intuitive understanding of what the analysis implies and how it would be affected by changes in assumptions
Comfort with dealing with ambiguity, making assumptions, and drawing conclusions
Substantial technical experience working with real-world data, including extracting it from production databases like Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake and cleaning it to create analytically tractable data sets
Familiarity with software development methodologies like Agile, including issue/workflow tracking tools like Jira and Trello and version control tools like git and GitHub
Familiarity with visualizing data using ggplot2, matplotlib, d3.js, Tableau, or similar software

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Join a leading Retail Media venture at the forefront of innovation!




At Unlimitail, we are building the future of retail media in Europe and LATAM, combining Carrefour Links' immense in-store and e-commerce assets with Publicis’ advanced retail media technology. Our ambition? To become the number one retail media platform in Continental Europe and South America. Already partnered with 15+ major players since our Vivatech launch, we're set to welcome many more retailers into our growing ecosystem




Role Overview:




Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.

As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.




Your Mission:




You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries on a wide variety of topics:




Perform ecommerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights
Conduct end to end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory
Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently
Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities
Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability
Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge capabilities to create the best retail media products




Qualifications:




Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a related field.
First experience in data analysis
Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.
Programming Languages: Python and SQL mandatory, any other is a plus
Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus
Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus
Problem-solving: Adept in approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.
Good communications skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively




What We Offer:




🗺️ Work in a fast-paced, international, and innovative environment

👨‍💻 A flexible remote work policy of 2 days/week

🥐 Office located in the heart of Paris (Châtelet district)

🚆 You'll receive a 90% reimbursement of public transportation

🍕 Enjoy a 10€/day Swile card for each working day, we'll cover 60% of the cost




Ready to make a big impact? Apply now and be part of our innovative journey!




Unlimitail is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from underrepresented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background.




If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Title: Data Analyst Junior H/F
Description:
DREAM ENERGY et ARTESOL filiales du groupe ARTEA, sont des entreprises engagées dans la transition énergétique, axées sur le développement et la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables, l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique. Avec une vision centrée sur la durabilité et la préservation de l'environnement, elles s'efforcent de proposer des technologies efficaces et respectueuses de la planète. Grâce à son expertise dans les énergies solaire et hydraulique, les filiales cherchent à répondre aux défis actuels liés au changement climatique en offrant des solutions viables et à fort impact environnemental.

En collaboration avec les ingénieurs et les responsables opérationnels, vous aurez à charge de concevoir les outils permettant l’amélioration des analyses de données sur l’ensemble des métiers du Groupe, à savoir l’énergie (centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques, hydrogène, biogaz), l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique (infrastructures de recharge AC / DC pour véhicules électriques).




MISSIONS

Dans ce contexte, vous occupez le poste de Data Analyst Junior H/F et vos principales missions seront les suivantes :




Collecte et gestion des données

Assurer la remontée et le stockage des données issues de nos centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques et infrastructures de recharge pour véhicules électriques.
Contribuer à la gestion et l’optimisation des bases de données (Cloud ou Serveur physique).

Analyse et visualisation

Exploiter les données pour identifier des tendances et améliorer la performance énergétique.
Mettre en place des tableaux de bord et indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) avec Power BI ou Excel.
Participer à l’élaboration de rapports analytiques sur les performances des installations.

Développement et automatisation

Aider à la conception d’outils facilitant le traitement et la croisée des bases de données.
Participer à l’intégration de données externes (météo, prix de l’électricité, etc.) pour affiner les analyses.
Contribuer au développement et à l'amélioration des API pour l’exploitation des données.




PROFIL RECHERCHE




Formation : Bac+5 en école d’ingénieur ou université avec spécialisation en Data Science, Informatique ou Énergie.

Compétences :

Maîtrise d’Excel (VBA souhaité).
Connaissance en SQL, Python et/ou Power BI.
Bonnes compétences analytiques et capacité à manipuler de grandes bases de données.
Esprit rigoureux, autonome et curieux.
Bon niveau d’anglais écrit et oral.




CONDITIONS D’EMPLOI

CDI 39h/semaine
1 RTT/mois
Tickets restaurants
Statut : Cadre
Rémunération : selon expérience




Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Claire Joster somos especialistas en la búsqueda y selección de Perfiles cualificados de Mando Intermedio y Management en el ámbito tecnológico para las principales áreas funcionales y técnicas, con un valor añadido fundamental: la captación de talento, basada en valores y ajuste cultural de nuestros clientes y candidatos.




Actualmente estamos buscando un perfil de Data Analyst para un partner tecnológico especializado en diseño y ejecución de soluciones tecnológicas en colaboración con importantes clientes, con dos pilares fundamentales: excelencia e innovación.




Requisitos:

Al menos 2 años de experiencia profesional como Analista de Datos.
Titulación en un campo cuantitativo (Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Física, etc…) o similar.
Capacidad de comunicación eficaz y capacidad para trabajar con otros departamentos.
Pensamiento lógico y resolutivo.
Dominio de SQL (SQL Server, Postgres).
Experiencia de trabajo con sistemas BI y herramientas de visualización.
2 años de experiencia en Power BI.
Usuario competente del paquete MS Office y usuario experto de Excel.




Se Ofrece:

Contrato indefinido y posibilidad de crecimiento.
Ubicación del cliente: Arturo Soria.
Modalidad Presencial.
Beneficios Sociales: Seguro médico.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A LBC é uma empresa de consultoria estratégica, transformação digital e de desenvolvimento de talento, com experiência em mais de 1.200 projetos em 18 países, 17 setores e 20 entidades multilaterais como o Banco Mundial, Programa das Nações Unidas para o Desenvolvimento, União Europeia, Banco Africano de Desenvolvimento, entre outros.

Requisitos


Licenciatura nas áreas de Gestão, Economia, Matemática, Estatística, Informática ou Gestão de Informação
3 anos de experiência em projetos de Data Analytics ou Business Intelligence
Experiência em projetos de Data Warehousing ou plataformas de business intelligence, Modelação de bases de dados, Bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL, Utilização de ferramentas ETL, Qualidade de Dados, Técnicas de Visualização e Reporting
Experiência em projetos com metodologias ágeis
Motivação, autonomia e rigor
Forte espírito de equipa e excelente capacidade colaborativa
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Python é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência Hadoop e stack Apache relacionada, principalmente Kafka é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Power BI é valorizado
Fluente em Português


Principais responsabilidades


Integração numa equipa multidisciplinar e participação em projetos de consultoria tecnológica
Apoio na implementação de novas fontes de informação e evolução de soluções inteligentes de gestão de dados
Análise e integração de dados relacionados com a atividade específica de cada cliente
Desenvolvimento de modelos de data quality
Desenvolvimento de modelos de sincronização de dados
Apoio na especificação funcional de soluções técnicas
Apoio no desenvolvimento e execução de testes
Colaboração direta com analistas de negócio, designers e developers


O que oferecemos


Uma oportunidade de trabalhar numa empresa líder e inovadora (premiada pela Revista Exame na categoria Digital Leaders 2023 e Melhores Empresas para Trabalhar)
Desenvolvimento contínuo de competências e carreira
Uma cultura de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio
Remuneração competitiva e pacote de benefícios


Candidata-te Já Pelo Nosso Site

The best future is the one you create and imagine for yourself

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales de Scalian. Dentro de este rol estarás desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Colaborar estrechamente con el Data Engineering Lead y su equipo para garantizar que los modelos de datos sean óptimos para el reporting.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de diseño de visualizaciones para asegurar claridad, accesibilidad y usabilidad.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




Requisitos mínimos:

Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.

#welcometoyourfuture




What you need to have/know:

Strong knowledge in SQL 🛠️
Proficient in Power BI 📊, Power Query, and M Language 🔄
Expertise in DAX for data modeling 💡




What we expect from you:

Ability to work independently and as part of a team 🤝
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 🔍
Passion for data and turning insights into action 🚀




What would be a plus (optional):

ETL Development experience 🔄
Knowledge of Python / R 🐍📈
Familiarity with VBA 💻
Advanced skills in Excel 📊




Language Skills:

English (minimum B2 level)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.
You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.
You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.
You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.
You develop new reports to support customers’ needs.
You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.
You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.
You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with “Tableau Certified Data Analyst” or higher.
You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.
You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM. (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.) or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)
You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.
You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems. (preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)
You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.
You are fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por ofrecerte las mejores oportunidades dentro del área tecnológica. Contamos con un equipo de más de 1000 profesionales.

Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.

Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Operaciones, Desarrollo de producto, Compras, Firmware, Software, Business Intelligence, Gestión, Transformación digital, ¡y muchas más! Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros Hubs Tecnológicos.

La persona seleccionada desarrollará dashboards mediante PowerBI para negocio

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:


Te encargarás del desarrollo y mantenimiento de los dashboards en PowerBI
Solucionarás incidencias de los dashboards existentes
Realizarás el modelado de los datos
Realizarás querys en SQL


¿Cómo lo haré?


Tendrás horario flexible
Te integrarás en un equipo de alto rendimiento y con un alto grado de especialización.
Podrás trabajar en modelo híbrido (2 o 3 días de presencialidad)
Tendrás un PC y los periféricos necesarios para el desarrollo de tu trabajo.
Podrás trabajar desde casa de cliente, nuestras oficinas de Barcelona en el 22@, los Hubs Tecnológicos o en el resto de las oficinas.
Trabajarás en un entorno internacional.


Si Eres BETWEENER Obtendrás Estos Beneficios


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Programa remunerado de recomendación de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.


Requisitos


Grado en Ade, Ingeniería o similares
2 años de experiencia mínimo en PowerBI: modelado de datos, Dax, powerquery, etc.
Experiencia básica en SQL
Inglés avanzado (mínimo C1)
Show more

Requisitos

  • Grado en Ade, Ingeniería o similares
  • 2 años de experiencia mínimo en PowerBI: modelado de datos, Dax, powerquery, etc.
  • Experiencia básica en SQL
  • Inglés avanzado (mínimo C1)

Title: Analista de Datos con PowerBI
Description:
Buscamos un Analista de Datos altamente motivado y experimentado para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data Science.




Como Anañista de Datos, serás responsable de analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, extraer patrones y crear modelos predictivos que ayuden a mejorar nuestras decisiones estratégicas.




Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos dinámicos que impactan directamente en el negocio y en la toma de decisiones a nivel global.




Responsabilidades:




· Recopilar, limpiar y organizar grandes conjuntos de datos estructurados y no estructurados.

· Desarrollar modelos de machine learning y algoritmos predictivos.

· Realizar análisis estadísticos y generar informes detallados para comunicar los resultados de manera efectiva.

· Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para identificar oportunidades de análisis de datos en diversas áreas del negocio.

· Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y fáciles de entender para los líderes de la empresa.

· Mejorar los procesos existentes mediante el uso de técnicas avanzadas de modelado y análisis.

· Desarrollar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y escalables.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (ESG) in Sustainability Office | SEB, Tallinn
Description:
SEB is a leading financial services group in Northern Europe, operating in over 20 countries worldwide. We are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to help drive impactful sustainability initiatives through lens of data. In this role, you will collaborate with various teams to develop ESG data solutions, provide insights, and support decision-making that advances SEB’s sustainability agenda. This is a unique opportunity to grow your expertise in ESG data within a financial institution which holds sustainability as its key strategical pillar. If you're eager to make your mark in advancing sustainability efforts in financial sector, this could be the role for you.

Join SEB Sustainability Office and accelerate the pace towards a sustainable future.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Managing ESG data across diverse areas, including sustainable finance, regulatory requirements, and risk management.
Assisting in ESG data collection, validation, and analysis for internal and external reporting.
Understanding business needs related to ESG data, compiling and analyzing datasets
Supporting the implementation and maintenance of ESG data tools and frameworks.
Assisting in the coordination of ESG data-related initiatives and projects.
Providing input in IT infrastructure development processes, including defining ESG-related data requirements.
Supporting other teams on ESG data-related inquiries and assisting in stakeholder communication.
Helping to comply with various data requirements (e.g. GDPR)


You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have


A strong interest in sustainability, particularly in financial sector.
Strong analytical skills and experience working with data, including structuring, processing, and interpreting datasets.
Experience with project coordination or working in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail and the ability to manage tasks in a structured manner.
A proactive mindset and willingness to contribute to the development of ESG data capabilities within SEB Baltics
Good communication skills and fluency in English (spoken and written).
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, SQL, or similar (considered an advantage).
Some knowledge of ESG-related regulations, sustainability reporting, or financial data analysis (considered an advantage).


We Offer


Extensive training and learning opportunities
Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
Possibilities to reskill by shifting areas/departments and location
A caring, supportive and respectful culture
Opportunities to help transform an industry


Do you want to be a part of SEB?

Welcome to join our inspiring culture and dedicated team distributed across the Baltic states and beyond.

We are looking forward to your English application by March 26, 2025.

Learn more about working at SEB https://www.seb.ee/en/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

The final offer (before tax deduction) will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Title: Reporting Analyst with Tableau
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for Reporting Analyst with experience with Tableau and will report to Data Mdeller manager.

You're Probably Wondering What You'll Do


Create reports and dashboards using Tableau or other tools, ensuring partners have reliable and applicable data
Perform in-depth benchmark analysis to provide valuable insights, uncover trends and business opportunities
Keep Tableau dashboards up to date, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance to meet evolving our needs
Address ad-hoc requests, troubleshoot data issues, and ensure, accurate reporting
Collaborate with analytical and consultancy teams across Experian using all communication channels


Qualifications

We look for you to bring:


University Degree in a quantitative subject as Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics, Economics, Physics or related
Good Excel (can perform complex functions) knowledge
Analytical and technical skills and Stay informed about relevant technology trends and developments
Very good command of English – both written and spoken
The following abilities will be considered an advantage:
Knowledge of the UK Credit Market
1+ years of experience with BI/Dashboarding/Reporting tools
Experience in SQL


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; World's Best Workplaces™ 2024 (Fortune Top 25), Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, and Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2024 to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Arkadium our purpose is to have fun while creating fun - and that's exactly what we've been doing for 20 years. We're the creators behind the world's most-played games. From the Solitaire that came on your Windows machine, to hundreds of other games you've come to know and love - you can find our games on Arkadium.com, iOS, Android, and lots of other big sites worldwide.

As a proud Evergreen business our values of Fierce Drive, Positive Energy and Living Full Lives are the driving force behind how we run and the choices we make.

We're privately held (aka stable and reasonable about growth), founder-led (aka passionate about our craft) and we consistently rank as a "Best Place to Work" (aka not your typical games company).

Interested in becoming an Arkadian? We'd love to hear from you!

Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in connecting business strategy with data-driven insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Operations, to analyze key metrics, interpret trends, and develop actionable recommendations that drive business growth. Beyond technical skills, we seek a candidate who can bridge the gap between data and decision-making, ensuring that insights translate into impactful business strategies.

What You'll Do:


Conduct ad-hoc analyses using statistical methods to answer business-critical questions.
Interpret and translate data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Define and own data processes, from event tracking and data collection to building structured datasets and dashboards.
Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and other business units to identify data needs and align analytics efforts with company objectives.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through proactive auditing, validation, and monitoring.
Work with engineering and data teams to enhance data pipelines, implement tracking strategies, and optimize data models.



Requirements

What You Bring:


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with expertise in statistical methods and hypothesis testing.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a problem-solving mindset to drive data-backed decisions.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in web analytics and understanding of website performance metrics.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure).
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) for data visualization.
Hands-on experience with Databricks or other big data processing platforms.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and marketing analytics.



Benefits

Why Join Arkadium?


High-Impact Role - Work at the intersection of strategy, execution, and technology, influencing the company's trajectory.
Fast-Paced, High-Growth Environment - No two days are the same. You'll be challenged, stretched, and given autonomy to make an impact.
Leadership & Growth Opportunity - Manage a small but high-impact team and take ownership of critical company initiatives.
Collaborative, Agile Culture - We move fast, work hard, and have fun while doing it.
Shape the Future - Be part of a company that is redefining browser gaming and driving innovation in the space.



Benefits


Competitive compensation with structured performance and career development check-ins.
Meaningful health insurance.
Meal allowance.
Personal development budget to fuel your passions and desire to learn (Arkadians are taking classes in not only Excel and leadership, but also interior design and even swimming!)
Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
Professional Coaching Budget .
Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.


This role is open to candidates based in Portugal. Business hours are 9-18 WEST (UTC+1). For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.
Show more

  • Meaningful health insurance.

  • Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!




Gain hands-on experience from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a recent graduate or early-career professional eager to build a strong foundation in data analysis? This is a unique opportunity to join a well-established Irish-owned company that values professional growth and provides a clear pathway to seniority.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst with 1–3 years of experience ready to take the next step in their career. In this role, you’ll gain exposure to real-world business challenges, working across multiple functions to transform complex data into valuable insights that drive strategic decision-making.




Under the guidance of a highly experienced Senior Data Analyst, you’ll receive hands-on training in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau, mastering end-to-end data workflows while making a meaningful impact from day one. This is the perfect opportunity to fast-track your career towards a Senior Data Analyst role!




You will:

Analyse large, complex datasets to uncover key business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence data-driven decisions.
Receive direct mentorship and structured career development.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.

Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €35,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Greetings,

We at TST Infotech have this urgent job opening for one of our valued customer, please let us know if you are interested for this role and share your updated CV along with B2B salary to proceed for this job opening.

Job Details

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Krakow, Poland (Onsite 2 days/week)

Mode: B2B contract through TST Infotech

Note - Candidates holding valid work permit and located in Poland are requested to apply for this opening.

Requirements


5 years of experience within Regulatory framework or complex organizations and multiple stakeholders with distinct expectations and requirements
Risk and Finance functions in a financial institution addressing a wide range of customers and products
Data Management strategies (knowledge of Data Management tools would be welcome)
Good understanding of IT systems and data flows
Knowledge of Regulatory requirements (i.e. BCBS239 or IFRS9) would be nice to have


Skills


Proficiency in English, French would be an asset, ability to navigate in an international multi-cultural environment
Excellent Excel and Power Point skills
Analytical skills, attention to details, understanding/assessment of large volumes of information
Ability to bond and collaborate across functions and businesses (in particular with other Risk and Finance teams, businesses and IT)


Best Regards and thank you,

Vivek Kumar

Email: vivek@tstinfotech.com

Job Details

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Krakow, Poland (Onsite 2 days/week)

Mode: B2B contract through TST Infotech

Note - Candidates holding valid work permit and located in Poland are requested to apply for this opening.

Requirements

  • 5 years of experience within Regulatory framework or complex organizations and multiple stakeholders with distinct expectations and requirements
  • Risk and Finance functions in a financial institution addressing a wide range of customers and products
  • Data Management strategies (knowledge of Data Management tools would be welcome)
  • Good understanding of IT systems and data flows
  • Knowledge of Regulatory requirements (i.e. BCBS239 or IFRS9) would be nice to have

Skills

  • Proficiency in English, French would be an asset, ability to navigate in an international multi-cultural environment
  • Excellent Excel and Power Point skills
  • Analytical skills, attention to details, understanding/assessment of large volumes of information
  • Ability to bond and collaborate across functions and businesses (in particular with other Risk and Finance teams, businesses and IT)

Best Regards and thank you,

Vivek Kumar

Email: vivek@tstinfotech.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description


In-Platform Quality Assurance: Conduct regular audits to maintain data integrity and platform performance.
Audience Testing: Proactively test and resolve issues before they impact operations.
Incident Handling: Troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
CDP Configurations & Governance: Manage configurations, approval flows, and access governance to align with business needs & compliance.
First-Line Support: Provide hands-on assistance toregional and central teams.
Documentation & Knowledge Sharing: Maintain clear documentation of configurations, workflows, and troubleshooting guides to support scalability and knowledge transfer.
Collaboration with Engineering & Data Teams: Work closely with data engineers and analysts to optimize data pipelines, resolve technical issues, and enhance CDP functionality.
Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and refine processes to improve efficiency in audience activation, segmentation, and data governance.


Qualifications


Hands-on experience withSaaS applications: CDP's, marketing automation tools and data integrations.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, particularly withinGCP BigQuery.
Experience withCDPSolutions( i.e. Hightouch, Mparticle, Segment, ActionIQ)is highly desirable.
Understanding how the CDP supports business users in achieving their goals and integrates with key business processes.
Deep understanding of GDPR and the importance of RBAC with the ability to manage configurations, user access, and platform governance processes.
Effective communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.


Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Data Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!





Show more

  • Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
